verses.name: Song of Songs 3:1
verses.text: In lectulo meo, per noctes,  quæsivi quem diligit anima mea :  quæsivi illum, et non inveni.

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:2
verses.text: Surgam, et circuibo civitatem :  per vicos et plateas  quæram quem diligit anima mea :  quæsivi illum, et non inveni.

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:3
verses.text: Invenerunt me vigiles qui custodiunt civitatem :  Num quem diligit anima mea vidistis ?

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:4
verses.text: Paululum cum pertransissem eos,  inveni quem diligit anima mea :  tenui eum, nec dimittam,  donec introducam illum in domum matris meæ,  et in cubiculum genetricis meæ.

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:5
verses.text: Adjuro vos, filiæ Jerusalem,  per capreas cervosque camporum,  ne suscitetis, neque evigilare faciatis dilectam,  donec ipsa velit.

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:6
verses.text: Quæ est ista quæ ascendit per desertum  sicut virgula fumi ex aromatibus myrrhæ,  et thuris, et universi pulveris pigmentarii ?

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:7
verses.text: En lectulum Salomonis sexaginta fortes ambiunt  ex fortissimis Israël,

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:8
verses.text: omnes tenentes gladios, et ad bella doctissimi :  uniuscujusque ensis super femur suum  propter timores nocturnos.

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:9
verses.text: Ferculum fecit sibi rex Salomon  de lignis Libani ;

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:10
verses.text: columnas ejus fecit argenteas,  reclinatorium aureum, ascensum purpureum ;  media caritate constravit,  propter filias Jerusalem.

verses.name: Song of Songs 3:11
verses.text: Egredimini et videte, filiæ Sion,  regem Salomonem in diademate quo coronavit illum mater sua  in die desponsationis illius,  et in die lætitiæ cordis ejus.
